A basic simple syrup is a great all-purpose sweetener for cocktails. In that case, you can definitely use it as a substitute in the Lavender Honey Spritz recipe.

Since your simple syrup is neutral in flavor, it won't affect the overall flavor profile of the drink. The honey will still provide a rich, velvety texture and a touch of sweetness, while the gin, lemon juice, and Prosecco will maintain their crisp, refreshing qualities.

You can proceed with using your basic simple syrup in the recipe, and it will likely turn out delicious. Just keep in mind that the drink might be slightly sweeter than the original recipe, since your simple syrup is made with a 1:1 ratio of water to sugar. If you prefer a less sweet drink, you can always adjust the amount of simple syrup to your taste.

Now, I'm curious – have you considered giving your signature cocktail a name? Naming a cocktail can add an extra layer of fun and personality to your dinner party. You could try combining words that reflect the flavors, ingredients, or atmosphere of your gathering. For example, "Summer Breeze Spritz" or "Honeyed Harmony" could be fitting names for your cocktail.
